definitions.text: a piece of furniture that provides a place to sleep
examples: he sat on the edge of the bed
the room had only a bed and chair

definitions.text: a plot of ground in which plants are growing
examples: the gardener planted a bed of roses

definitions.text: a depression forming the ground under a body of water
examples: he searched for treasure on the ocean bed

definitions.text: (geology) a stratum of rock (especially sedimentary rock)
examples: they found a bed of sandstone

definitions.text: a stratum of ore or coal thick enough to be mined with profit
examples: he worked in the coal beds

definitions.text: single thickness of usually some homogeneous substance
examples: slices of hard-boiled egg on a bed of spinach

definitions.text: the flat surface of a printing press on which the type form is laid in the last stage of producing a newspaper or magazine or book etc.
a foundation of earth or rock supporting a road or railroad track
examples: the track bed had washed away
The inn keeper could bed all the new arrivals

definitions.text: place (plants) in a prepared bed of soil

examples: The children were bedded at ten o'clock
This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm
Were you ever intimate with this man?
I usually turn in at midnight
He goes to bed at the crack of dawn
